page.title: 05Local History in Nibley
page.content: At Nibley Green in 1471 the last private battle in England was fought. It was between William Berkeley and Lord Lisle of Wotton, to settle the family feud as to who was the rightful heir to the Berkeley estate. Both men had armies of about 500 men and the battle was won by the Berkeleys, after Lord Lisle was shot in the eye. The Berkeley family owned the Nibley area from 1126-1920. They then were forced to sell it to pay off their debts. In 1845 the remains of a Roman villa were discovered in the grounds of Stancombe Park, by the man who lived there, Mr. Purnell. Following excavations, the finds were sent to Gloucester Museum. Unfortunately all the evidence of the villa was lost. Farming and to a lesser extentthe woollen industry have been the main influences in the area.
